content.description: Start on stacked blocks 5' left of Big Ol' Crack. Climb up cracks and jugs to the offwidth. Get in the wide crack at half height and move up being careful of blocks lodged in the crack. The are jugs throughout the climb if you feel around for them. Exit the crack to a tree ledge. Finish up another 15' section of rock to the trees above. Rap the route or walk off.
content.location: 5' left of Big Ol' Crack in The Inlet

content.description: Start up on the blocks below the crack lines. Move left to the slab with a large tree branch going across it down low. Shimmy behind the branch and stand on a large foot ledge on the right side. Continue up the slab on good holds to the tree ledge above. Find a good tree to rap from or walk off left.
content.location: The slab just left of the cracks in The Inlet

content.description: Climb up the short unprotected slab to a short overhang. Get gear and pull out the overhang into the large crack. Climb the crack until it ends. Finish up the series of headwalls to the trees at the top.
content.location: The Inlet, Uphill left of the overhanging wall

content.description: This small area is located just uphill and left of the overhanging wall. There is a very distinct wide crack line and corner that identify the area.
